# Day of the Warrior__disambig_1

| runtime        = 96 minutes
| country        = United States
| language       = English
| budget         =
}}
Day of the Warrior (also known as L.E.T.H.A.L. Ladies: Day of the Warrior) is a 1996 action adventure film written and directed by Andy Sidaris and starring Kevin Light and Julie Strain. It is the eleventh and penultimate instalment in  Andy Sidaris'  Triple B film series.
Plot
A team of female agents must stop the scheme of the Warrior, a former CIA agent turned criminal freelancer, who stole the agency's computer database and is now going after undercover agents one by one.
Cast
* Kevin Light as "Doc" Austin
* Cristian Letelier as J. Tyler Ward
* Julie Strain as Willow Black
* Julie K. Smith as "Cobra"
* Shae Marks as "Tiger"
* Marcus Bagwell as "Warrior"
* Raye Hollitt as Kym
* Rodrigo Obreg√≥n as Manuel
* Justin Melvey as Jordon
* Gerald Okamura as Fu
* Richard Cansino as J.P.
* Cassidy Phillips as Chaz
* Tammy Parks as "Scorpion"
* Darren Wise as "Shark"
* Ted Prior as Dietrich
* Kevin Eastman as Harry "The Cat"
Release
Day of the Warrior was broadcast on Cinemax. It was released on Blu-Ray in 2020.
Reception
A retrospective review by Charleston Picou from Horror News Net in 2020 states that "Day of the Warrior is an exploitative movie that's pretty blatant about what its intentions are. However, it still manages to have its own charm in not only in embracing the ridiculous, but also how openly un-PC it is. It's the kind of film that could have only been made in the halcyon days of the 1990s. Check it out."
The film gained retrospective cult following.
